name: places/ChIJZSVCe9NZwokR3jBo7JWEdhk
formattedAddress: 604 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 604 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
Apparently there’s a late “policy”, not conspicuous at all, that you’re not allowed to enter a class after 5 minutes.
I arrived 6-7 minutes late after ubering from across town in stressful traffic just to get the receptionist quickly to let me know I couldn’t come in LOL ok, as if it’s a freaking plane. Really ruins the whole experience of a nice workout. I had convinced two gfs to come with me but tbh customer service should be prioritized, and it’s not at this location. So irrational, I’m not coming back.

originalText.text:
Best workout class in NYC. You will have abs if you stick w it.

Late cancel fees are really rough though @ $40 if you don’t cancel 10 hours before. Life happens and you’ve already paid $40 for the class. Total cost of missing a class $80.

originalText.text:
The gym and instructors are amazing.
It's a shame management is not up to par.
I had the same experience.
Had medical issues earlier this year, couldn't attend the gym for a few months, and  I emailed to try and get credits back for months I wasn't able to exercise. Mind you,  I could've made it harder and asked for  money back, but I do, genuinely, enjoy their classesm
It's been almost a month and I haven't heard back from the "Client Experience Team".
This kind of service is unacceptable in general, but especially for the kind of prices they charge.

originalText.text: The workout is great, the instructors are overall delightful, but this business's late fees and cancellation policies (both individual classes and your membership when you get fed up with them) are appalling. I tried to cancel my membership 3 days after my monthly charge date, but I was told that the 30 day written notice meant 30 days + the remaining month, i.e., if you get charged on the 1st, cancel in writing on the 4th, you will not be prorated for the 3 days on the following month, but will be charged for an entire month. Given the astronomical pricing (which has only gone up and up and up since I joined, and the 20% off ANY memberships "forever", even if I stepped down from unlimited to a set number of classes, that they promised me after I did my $99 new client intro special no longer applying when I did, in fact, step down), you're better off just joining a gym and paying a personal trainer. You'll get better, safer, more personalized results, and you won't be paying $40(!) late cancel fees AND not being allowed to workout when you show up to class 6 minutes late after being stuck on a train.

You'll get better, safer, more personalized results, and you won't be paying $40(!) late cancel fees AND not being allowed to workout when you show up to class 6 minutes late after being stuck on a train.

originalText.text:
So bad customer experience! It is so difficult to cancel the purchased package!!! I recently moved to New Jersey, and want to cancel my auto payment. I told to the front desk and she told me her computer freeze and asked me to write down my name and email. I did, but never received email from her. After moving, I just want to finish the remaining class I have in my account for this month (still have 7 classes) , but in the system, it shows the package I brought is for New York, which means I need to buy extra class for New Jersey Location. That’s ridiculous!!! I called them but no one answered the phone, so I have to drive 40 mins to the New Jersey location, and the girl in the front desk asked me to write down my name and phone number as well, and said she would contact me by email. Seriously? I am here right now in the studio, why you can’t just help me cancel on your laptop??

I had great experience with them before, but now I am very disappointed. The company should have more humanized process when customer want to cancel or unsubscribe.
